translated: the path of the vultures is long-lasting;
There your mother and father are,
the vulture is supporting the old ones;
has given a great deal of fat.
And the father said to his son,
knowing that he was flying high;
When you know, dear, that the earth🔽is surrounded by the ocean,

analyzed: uda pattā asi vegena  balī pakkhī dijuttamaḥ
translated: You are flying fast,🔽the powerful bird, the supreme flyer;
at the mountains and the forests.
just as he had heard from his father;
and turned back only after going to the very end;
gave the powerful bird a blow.
The man was not able to go beyond,
and was captured by the Verambhas.
and those who lived with him,
because Dīja did not heed the advice.

original: Evampi idha vuḍḍhānaṁ,🔽yo vākyaṁ nāvabujjhati;🔽Atisīmacaro ditto,
analyzed: evampi idha vuḍḍhāna  yaḥ vākyam na avabujjhati  ati sīma caraḥ dittaḥ
translated: So too, one who does not understand🔽the words of the elders here,🔽who goes beyond the limit, intoxicated,
who passes beyond the Buddha’s instruction,
not having done the elders’ instruction.”
The Jātaka of the Peacock is the first.
